meanings.sent1: After the sword broke, the blacksmith was reforging it to make it whole again.
meanings.sent2: The blacksmith spent hours reforging the metal to create a new masterpiece.
meanings.sent3: The blacksmith joked that he was reforging the sword so many times, it was starting to feel like a family member.
meanings.sent4: The process of reforging the metal was like breathing new life into it.
meanings.sent5: The sound of the hammer reforging the metal echoed through the workshop.

meanings.definition: To reshape or remake by forging again
meanings.sent1: The artist was reforging the sculpture to give it a more dynamic shape.
meanings.sent2: Reforging the key was the only way to open the ancient lock.
meanings.sent3: The blacksmith was reforging the horseshoe into a unique shape for good luck.
meanings.sent4: The idea of reforging memories through art was both intriguing and inspiring.
meanings.sent5: The process of reforging the metal transformed it into a work of art.
